sentences.sContent: Resist the temptation to buy the item until you’re certain you need it.
sentences.sCn: 要抵挡住购买的诱惑，除非你确有需要。

sentences.sContent: I finally gave in to the temptation and had a cigarette.
sentences.sCn: 我最终还是屈从诱惑，抽了一支烟。

sentences.sContent: ...Large companies have a difficult time switching to new markets because there is a temptation to put existing assets into the new businesses...
...so long as Barack Obama and the Democrats in Congress resist the temptation to interfere too much...
...Although many other big firms resisted the temptation to over-borrow...
...Large companies have a difficult time switching to new markets because there is a temptation to put existing assets into the new businesses...

words.tran: 诱惑；引起；冒…的风险；使感兴趣

trans.tranOther: a strong desire to have or do something even though you know you should not
